wordpressWpDailyReads.title: Daily Reads 8/26/2019
wordpressWpDailyReads.content:
Donald Trump’s trade war may have the president focused on China, but the recent drop in the Dow Jones has many thinking he needs to direct his attention at home. We take a look at Trump’s recent trip to France to discuss the trade war with China, and why it has financial leaders worried. Retirees often approach their finances with restrain, but this lack of spending is turning out to be depriving them of enjoying their golden years to the fullest. Learn about Social Security’s “COLA” and how it is designed to counter inflation for your retirement. And football season is here, learn about what broadcasters have in store for this pivotal moment in broadcast history.

MARKETS

For Baffled Wall Street, Trump Markets Are ‘Weirder’ Than the 2008 Crisis

Donald Trump’s trying to win a trade war, so don’t talk to him about 600 points in the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

One Crazy Day Showed How Political Chaos Threatens the World Economy

Nervous Retirees Are Too Scared to Spend

The U.S. economic recovery, the longest in recorded history, has increased Americans’ wealth by $52 trillion, according to the Federal Reserve.

 

An Early Look at Social Security’s 2020 COLA

The big day is coming. In about two and a half months’ time, the Social Security Administration will release its 2020 update that highlights all of the changes to the Social Security program in the upcoming year.
